meanings.definition: Floatbases (noun): The bases on which a float rests in a parade.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, the floatbases supported the colorful float.
meanings.sent2: The float gracefully moved along the street, supported by its floatbases.
meanings.sent3: The floatbases decided to take a break and let the float do all the work.
meanings.sent4: The floatbases were the sturdy foundation that kept the float soaring high.
meanings.sent5: Children cheered as the floatbases carried the float with ease.

meanings.definition: Floatbases (verb): To place or position a float on its bases.
meanings.sent1: The parade organizers carefully floatbases the giant float before the event.
meanings.sent2: They floatbases the float in the perfect spot for everyone to see.
meanings.sent3: Trying to floatbases the float in a hurry led to a comical mishap.
meanings.sent4: She expertly floatbases the float, ensuring it was secure and stable.
meanings.sent5: The team floatbases the float with precision and teamwork.

meanings.definition: Floatbases (adjective): Describing something related to or characteristic of float bases.
meanings.sent1: The floatbases decorations added a festive touch to the parade.
meanings.sent2: People admired the floatbases design of the parade decorations.
meanings.sent3: The floatbases theme made the parade even more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her floatbases costume perfectly matched the float's theme.
meanings.sent5: The floatbases elements created a magical atmosphere during the parade.
